name: market for woven bamboo mat | woven bamboo mat | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/24636/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This dataset represents the Chinese market for woven bamboo mat. Transport distances were estimated using the methodology presented in Zea Escamilla and Habert (2017). ;Woven bamboo mats are produced in an handcrafted process and are usually used as lightweight walls but have also recently been used for industrially produced panels (Xiao, 2009). ;;References: ;Xiao, Y. Development of Prefabricated bamboo Earthquake Relief Shelter. in International conference of modern bamboo structures. 2009. Bogotá, Colombia: Universidad de los Andes;;;Zea Escamilla, E., Habert, G. Method and application of characterisation of life cycle impact data of construction materials using geographic information systems. Int J Life Cycle Assess 22, 1210–1219 (2017). https://doi.org/10.1007/s11367-016-1238-y"

The activity starts with the woven bamboo mat  leaving the production site.

The activity ends with woven bamboo mat  being delivered to the consuming entity
category: C:Manufacturing/16:Manufacture of wood and of products of wood and cork, except furniture; manufacture of articles of straw and plaiting materials/162:Manufacture of products of wood, cork, straw and plaiting materials

exchanges.description: A transport distance of 398.3 Kg*Km has been assumed. This is an estimated value based on the methodology presented in Zea Escamilla, E. and G. Habert, Method and application of characterisation of life cycle impact data of construction materials using geographic information systems. The International Journal of Life Cycle Assessment, 2016: p. 1-10.
